item.title: タッカー・カールソンはいかにして文化戦争における極右の旗手となったのか、彼の米国政治への暗い影響はFox News退社後も続きそうだ（Jason Zengerle/New York Times）。
item.description:
Jason Zengerle / New York Times:
How Tucker Carlson became the far right's standard-bearer in the culture wars, as his dark influence on US politics is set to continue after his Fox News ouster  —  For the quarter-century-plus that the Fox News Channel has been coming into America's living rooms, it has operated according …

item.title: ブラジルでソーシャルメディアを規制する「フェイクニュース法案」が来週採決される。プラットフォームは自主規制を主張し、批判者は言論の自由に関する懸念を表明している（Tabata Viapiana/Brazil Reports）。
item.description:
Tabata Viapiana / Brazil Reports:
Brazil's “fake news bill” to regulate social media is set for a vote next week, as platforms argue for self-regulation and critics raise free speech concerns  —  São Paulo, Brazil - Backed by the federal government and a majority of Supreme Court judges …

item.title: ハリウッドで労働契約交渉が過熱する中、脚本家や俳優を代表する組合が、AIが制作した素材の使用制限を求める（New York Times）
item.description:
New York Times:
As labor contract negotiations heat up in Hollywood, unions representing screenwriters and actors seek limits on the use of AI-produced material  —  As labor contract negotiations heat up in Hollywood, unions representing writers and actors seek limits on artificial intelligence.

item.title: WHCDでバイデン大統領は、エヴァン・ガーシュコビッチとオースティン・タイスの釈放を求め、彼らの家族へのサポートを提供し、「ジャーナリズムは犯罪ではない」と述べた（Dominic Patten/Deadline）。
item.description:
Dominic Patten / Deadline:
At the WHCD, President Biden called for the release of Evan Gershkovich and Austin Tice, offered support to their families, and said “journalism is not a crime”  —  “I believe in the First Amendment, and not just because my good friend Jimmy Madison wrote it,” …

item.title: ジェームズ・コーデンが退社し、衰退する深夜テレビの現状を見る。情報源：彼の番組の制作費は年間$60M～$65Mだが、収入は$45M以下（Brian Stelter/Los Angeles Magazine）。
item.description:
Brian Stelter / Los Angeles Magazine:
A look at the diminished state of late-night TV as James Corden departs; sources: his show cost $60M to $65M per year to produce but brought in less than $45M  —  James Corden Bows Out  —  The Late Late Show host is leaving the airwaves—and Los Angeles—as the late-night format struggles to stay awake.

item.title: イーロン・マスク氏は、Twitterが2023年5月から、メディアパブリッシャーがワンクリックで記事ごとにユーザーに課金できるようにする計画だと主張（Elon Musk/@elonmusk）
item.description:
Elon Musk / @elonmusk:
Elon Musk claims that Twitter plans to let media publishers charge users on a per-article basis, with one click, starting in May 2023  —  Rolling out next month, this platform will allow media publishers to charge users on a per article basis with one click. This enables users who would not sign up for a monthly subscription to pay a higher per article price for when they want to read an occasional article.... https://twitter.com/...

item.title: BuzzFeed Newsの死と、肥大化したソーシャルメディアの巨人たちによるどこにも行けないピボットは、ニュースメディアが投機的なハイテク産業と結婚することの不条理を示している（John Herrman/New York Magazine）。
item.description:
John Herrman / New York Magazine:
The death of BuzzFeed News and the pivots to nowhere by bloated social media giants show the absurdity of the news media marrying a speculative tech industry  —  The media bet its future on Facebook.  Did it learn from that mistake?  —  BuzzFeed, the archetypal new media company of the 2010s …

item.title: ウィキメディアは、オンライン安全法案による英国の読者や貢献者の年齢チェックに応じず、財団の「最小限のデータ収集へのコミットメント」を理由にする（BBC）。
item.description:
BBC:
Wikimedia won't comply with the Online Safety Bill's age checks of its UK readers or contributors, citing the foundation's “commitment to collect minimal data”  —  Wikipedia will not comply with any age checks required under the Online Safety Bill, its foundation says.

item.title: [スレッド】ハーストマガジンズのWGAイーストメンバー、長年の交渉の末、来週からの批准投票を前提とした組合契約を締結したと発表 (@hearstunion)
item.description:
@hearstunion:
[Thread] WGA East members at Hearst Magazines announce they have a union contract, subject to a ratification vote starting next week, after years of bargaining  —  BREAKING NEWS: We have reached a deal! Details tk, but we're so proud of our awesome bargaining committee, @WGAEast organizers and staff, and our entire unit for reaching a historic win not just for @Hearst but for the entire media industry. Hearst has a union contract, world! https://twitter.com/...

item.title: 4月29日にホワイトハウス特派員晩餐会の司会を務めるコメディアンでデイリーショー特派員のロイ・ウッド・ジュニアに、ニュースサイクルなどについてインタビュー（Rachel Treisman/NPR)
item.description:
Rachel Treisman / NPR:
An interview with comedian and Daily Show correspondent Roy Wood Jr., who is hosting the White House Correspondents' Dinner on April 29, on the news cycle, more  —  Some of the biggest names in politics and media will gather in Washington, D.C., Saturday night for the White House Correspondents' Dinner …

item.title: Advertising Association/WARC: 2022年の英国の広告費は前年比8.8%増の£348B、ニュース・雑誌は前年比1%減の£188B、うちオンラインは2%増の937M（Aisha Majid/Press Gazette)
item.description:
Aisha Majid / Press Gazette:
Advertising Association/WARC: UK ad spend grew 8.8% YoY to £34.8B in 2022 and fell 1% YoY to £1.88B across news and magazines, of which £937M was online, up 2%  —  AA/WARC data reveals overall UK ad spend grew in 2022 although spending on news fell slightly.

item.title: ジャーナリズムやその視聴者、ファクトチェックなどに関する学術研究にスポットを当てたニュースレター「RQ1」に関するマーク・コディントンとセス・ルイスのQ&A（Angie Drobnic Holan/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Angie Drobnic Holan / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with Mark Coddington and Seth Lewis about RQ1, their newsletter spotlighting academic research about journalism, its audience, fact-checking, and more  —  “It's the inherent instability in the space that makes it so fascinating to many researchers.”

item.title: 視聴者のニッチは小さすぎて埋められないという概念に特化した無料ストリーミングサービスTubiが、50K以上のタイトルと64M以上のMAUでインターネットの心をつかんだ理由（Josef Adalian/Vulture)
item.description:
Josef Adalian / Vulture:
How Tubi, a free streaming service dedicated to the notion that no audience niche is too small to fill, won the internet's heart with 50K+ titles and 64M+ MAUs  —  How the weird, free streamer won the internet's heart.  —  In February, as roughly 110 million football fans sweated …

item.title: EU議員、AI法の草案を推進、生成型AIツールを導入する企業に学習に使用した著作物の開示義務付けなど（ロイター）
item.description:
Reuters:
EU lawmakers push forward an AI Act draft, which includes requiring companies deploying generative AI tools to disclose copyrighted material used for training  —  Companies deploying generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, will have to disclose any copyrighted material used to develop their systems …

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズは、一部のニュース記事を「Why It Matters」のようなセクションに分割する新しいフォーマットを使用しており、一部の記者には記事を短くするよう指示している（Alexandra Bruell/@alexbruell）。
item.description:
Alexandra Bruell / @alexbruell:
The New York Times is using a new format that breaks down some news articles into sections like “Why It Matters” and has told some reporters to shorten stories  —  Mini scoop: The New York Times is using a new format that breaks down some news articles into sections, such as “Why It Matters.” Feels very Axios. Here's an example https://www.nytimes.com/...
